name: RenderX Web Orchestration
title: RenderX Web - Master Orchestration Pipeline
description: Six-movement orchestration managing the complete RenderX Web lifecycle: initialization, building, testing, validation, delivery, and monitoring. Coordinates build system, test execution (E2E Cypress), compliance validation, deployment pipeline, telemetry instrumentation, and recovery operations.
purpose: Provide centralized orchestration and governance for RenderX Web application ensuring coordinated build, test, validation, deployment, and operational monitoring across all integration points.
trigger: CI/CD pipeline initiation, code commit, or explicit deployment request

policies: Build system must pass pre-build-pipeline-check-symphony validation
E2E Cypress tests must maintain ≥ 85% pass rate
Compliance validation must complete with 0 critical violations
Delivery pipeline must orchestrate through pipeline-delivery-execute-symphony
Telemetry instrumentation must be collected via generate-telemetry-instrumentation-symphony
Recovery procedures must be available through pipeline-recovery-symphony
All operations subject to 37-beat enforcement pipeline

movements.name: Initialization
movements.description: Initialize RenderX Web build environment and dependencies
movements.userStory: As a Build Orchestrator, I want to initialize build context and validate prerequisites so that the build pipeline executes with consistent state and validated dependencies.
movements.businessValue: Reduces build failures due to missing/invalid dependencies; enables reproducible builds; establishes traceability baseline

beats.name: resolve-theme
acceptanceCriteria: Handler executes successfully and completes
Output is valid and conforms to schema
Event is published to event stream
Telemetry is recorded for monitoring
No errors or warnings are logged
beats.userStory: As a system user, I want the header/ui#getCurrentTheme operation to execute reliably so that system functions operate as expected.

movements.userStory: As a Build Orchestrator, I want to compile source code and generate artifacts so that downstream processes have validated, executable output.
movements.businessValue: Ensures code quality; catches compilation errors early; generates deployment-ready artifacts

movements.businessValue: Detects regressions; validates architecture governance; prevents non-compliant code deployment

beats.name: notify-ui
acceptanceCriteria: When class changes occur, notifyUi publishes a 'control.panel.classes.updated' event
The event payload contains the element ID and updated classes list
The notification is published only when payload contains updated class data
Event is published to the global EventRouter for downstream listeners
Notifications maintain consistency across multiple class changes
beats.userStory: As a system integrator, I want UI class changes to be published as events so that other components can react to styling state transitions.

movements.name: Delivery
movements.userStory: As a Release Manager, I want to coordinate deployment and publish artifacts so that the application reaches users with minimal downtime.
movements.businessValue: Enables reliable, repeatable deployments; supports blue-green/canary strategies; reduces deployment risk
